headline: AppLovin CEO Downplays Risks From AI
summary: AppLovin’s  chief executive officer downplayed the threat artificial intelligence poses to his advertising platform, arguing that the company will only continue to benefit from more advanced AI models.  CEO  Adam Foroughi  kicked off the company’s Wednesday earnings call looking to soothe investor jitters after shares of AppLovin, as well as other software stocks, slid last week on fresh concerns that AI may render their businesses obsolete.  AppLovin’s revenue has jumped by double-digits in recent quarters.

content.title: AppLovin CEO Downplays Risks From AI
content.summary: AppLovin’s  chief executive officer downplayed the threat artificial intelligence poses to his advertising platform, arguing that the company will only continue to benefit from more advanced AI models.  CEO  Adam Foroughi  kicked off the company’s Wednesday earnings call looking to soothe investor jitters after shares of AppLovin, as well as other software stocks, slid last week on fresh concerns that AI may render their businesses obsolete.  AppLovin’s revenue has jumped by double-digits in recent quarters.

headline: APP Q4 Deep Dive: Guidance Surprises to Upside, Market Focuses on Competitive Risks
summary: Mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 20.8% year on year to $1.66 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $1.76 billion at the midpoint, 3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.48 per share was 11.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: APP Q4 Deep Dive: Guidance Surprises to Upside, Market Focuses on Competitive Risks
content.summary: Mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 20.8% year on year to $1.66 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $1.76 billion at the midpoint, 3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.48 per share was 11.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: AppLovin Reports Strong Earnings. The Stock Is Down.
summary: AppLovin  reported solid fourth-quarter earnings Wednesday afternoon.  Earnings per share were $3.24, ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $2.95.  Despite the beat in guidance, the sales outlook represented a slowdown in revenue revenue growth, to 52%.

content.title: AppLovin Reports Strong Earnings. The Stock Is Down.

headline: Cisco helps drag Wall Street lower as investors try to separate AI winners from losers
summary: AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on the worries, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.  “There’s a real disconnect between market sentiment and the reality of our business,” he said.  Cisco Systems dropped 11.1% despite topping analysts’ expectations for profit and revenue last quarter.

headline: US stocks drop as investors try to separate AI losers from winners
summary: U.S. stocks are dropping Thursday as the market splits further between perceived losers and winners from the rush into artificial-intelligence technology.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on such worries, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.  “There’s a real disconnect between market sentiment and the reality of our business,” he said.

content.title: US stocks drop as investors try to separate AI losers from winners
content.summary: U.S. stocks are dropping Thursday as the market splits further between perceived losers and winners from the rush into artificial-intelligence technology.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on such worries, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.  “There’s a real disconnect between market sentiment and the reality of our business,” he said.

headline: US stocks drop as investors hunt for potential losers from AI
summary: Like other software companies, it’s come under pressure recently from worries that AI may undercut its business while fundamentally changing how people use the internet.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on the concerns, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.  “There’s a real disconnect between market sentiment and the reality of our business,” he said.

content.title: US stocks drop as investors hunt for potential losers from AI
content.summary: Like other software companies, it’s come under pressure recently from worries that AI may undercut its business while fundamentally changing how people use the internet.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on the concerns, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.  “There’s a real disconnect between market sentiment and the reality of our business,” he said.

thumbnail.caption: James Conti works on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange in New York, Thursday, Feb. 12, 2026. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig)

headline: How major US stock indexes fared Thursday, 2/12/2026
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1.3% and the Nasdaq composite lost 2%. Cisco Systems was one of the heaviest weights on the market after warning of potentially higher expenses, while AppLovin tumbled as worries about AI competition continue to hit software companies. Treasury yields tumbled in the bond market ahead of Friday's coming report on inflation at the U.S. consumer level.

content.title: How major US stock indexes fared Thursday, 2/12/2026
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1.3% and the Nasdaq composite lost 2%. Cisco Systems was one of the heaviest weights on the market after warning of potentially higher expenses, while AppLovin tumbled as worries about AI competition continue to hit software companies. Treasury yields tumbled in the bond market ahead of Friday's coming report on inflation at the U.S. consumer level.

summary: ↘️ Cisco Systems (CSCO): The networking-equipment company logged higher revenue due to increasing AI hyperscaler demand. headline: US stocks drop sharply as investors hunt for losers that will be hurt by AI
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 669 points, or 1.3%, and the Nasdaq composite fell 2%.  Like other software companies, it’s come under pressure from worries that AI may undercut its business while fundamentally changing how people use the internet.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on the concerns, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.

content.title: US stocks drop sharply as investors hunt for losers that will be hurt by AI
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 669 points, or 1.3%, and the Nasdaq composite fell 2%.  Like other software companies, it’s come under pressure from worries that AI may undercut its business while fundamentally changing how people use the internet.  AppLovin CEO Adam Foroughi pushed back on the concerns, saying in a conference call with analysts that indicators show his company is doing well.
